summary: The AWS Cloud Practitioner course provides foundational knowledge about AWS Cloud technologies. Participants will learn to define what the AWS Cloud is and understand its basic global infrastructure. The course covers AWS Cloud architectural principles, the value proposition of AWS Cloud, and key services on the AWS platform along with their common use cases, such as compute and analytics. It also addresses basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform, including the shared security model. Additionally, the course explains billing, account management, and pricing models, and identifies sources of documentation or technical assistance. Participants will also gain insights into the core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud. The course spans 10 sessions, totaling 50 academic hours, and is offered in a hybrid format, allowing participants to choose between attending on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan or via Zoom. Classes are held on Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00. The course begins on November 29, 2024.

COURSE NAME: AWS Cloud Practitioner

COURSE OVERVIEW: This course is designed to introduce participants to AWS Cloud technologies. It provides foundational knowledge about the AWS Cloud, its infrastructure, and its services. Participants will gain an understanding of the AWS Cloud value proposition, architectural principles, and operational characteristics. The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Explain the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Describe key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Discuss basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Define the billing, account management, and pricing models.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 29.11.2024.
- Duration: 10 sessions.
- Academic Hours: 50 hours.
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00.

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held on-campus at Bar-Ilan University in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participants' preference.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and register, contact: 
  - Phone: 052-5886002.
  - Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber, a division of Bar-Ilan University dedicated to specialized programs.

CERTIFICATIONS: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner, Foundational.
